legal_basis: Infringement occurs if all essential elements of a patent claim are present in the product. Claims must be construed purposively, identifying essential and non-essential elements.
expert_testimony: The case involved extensive expert testimonies
patent_validity: The court ruled that claim 15 of the '787 Patent is valid
technical_details: Bell's Legacy gear was found to contain all essential elements of claim 15 of the '787 Patent, while the Production gear lacked the double curvature and integrated front cross piece
decision_outcome: Eurocopter succeeded partially; an injunction against the Legacy gear was granted, and punitive damages were awarded. However, most claims were invalidated, limiting Eurocopter's remedy.
cause_of_action: Eurocopter alleged that Bell's helicopter landing gears (Legacy and Production) infringed its '787 Patent, specifically claims related to skid-type landing gear design.
